children.description: Array of block objects to append. Each block must follow the Notion block schema.

rich_text.description: Array of rich text objects representing the comment content.

equation.description: Equation object if type is 'equation'. Represents an inline LaTeX equation.

expression.description: LaTeX string representing the inline equation.

annotations.description: Styling information for the text. By default, give nothing for default text.

text.description: Object containing text content and optional link info. Required if type is 'text'.

link.description: Optional link object with a 'url' field. Do NOT provide a NULL value, just ignore this field no link.

url.description: The URL the text links to.

href.description: The URL of any link or mention in this text, if any. Do NOT provide a NULL value, just ignore this field if there is no link or mention.

type.description: The type of this rich text object. Possible values: text, mention, equation.

mention.description: Mention object if type is 'mention'. Represents an inline mention of a database, date, link preview, page, template mention, or user.

date.description: Date mention object, containing a date property value object.

start.description: An ISO 8601 formatted start date or date-time.

end.description: An ISO 8601 formatted end date or date-time, or null if not a range.

time_zone.description: Time zone information for start and end. If null, times are in UTC.

database.description: Database mention object. Contains a database reference with an 'id' field.

id.description: The ID of the mentioned database.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

link_preview.description: Link Preview mention object, containing a URL for the link preview.

url.description: The URL for the link preview.

template_mention.description: Template mention object, can be a template_mention_date or template_mention_user.

template_mention_user.description: For template_mention_user type, the user keyword.

template_mention_date.description: For template_mention_date type, the date keyword.

page.description: Page mention object, containing a page reference with an 'id' field.

id.description: The ID of the mentioned page.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

user.description: User mention object, contains a user reference.

id.description: The ID of the user.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

type.description: Type of the block. Possible values include 'paragraph', 'heading_1', 'heading_2', 'heading_3', 'bulleted_list_item', 'numbered_list_item', 'to_do', 'toggle', 'child_page', 'child_database', 'embed', 'callout', 'quote', 'equation', 'divider', 'table_of_contents', 'column', 'column_list', 'link_preview', 'synced_block', 'template', 'link_to_page', 'audio', 'bookmark', 'breadcrumb', 'code', 'file', 'image', 'pdf', 'video'. Not all types are supported for creation via API.

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

after.description: The ID of the existing block that the new block should be appended after.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

block_id.description: The ID of the parent block.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

tools.name: notion_append_block_children
tools.description: Append new children blocks to a specified parent block in Notion. Requires insert content capabilities. You can optionally specify the 'after' parameter to append after a certain block.

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

block_id.description: The ID of the block to retrieve.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

start_cursor.description: Pagination cursor for next page of results

block_id.description: The ID of the block.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

tools.name: notion_retrieve_block_children
tools.description: Retrieve the children of a block

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

block_id.description: The ID of the block to delete.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

block.description: The updated content for the block. Must match the block's type schema.

block_id.description: The ID of the block to update.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

tools.name: notion_update_block
tools.description: Update the content of a block in Notion based on its type. The update replaces the entire value for a given field.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to retrieve.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

page_id.description: The ID of the page or database item to update.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

properties.description: Properties to update. These correspond to the columns or fields in the database.

tools.name: notion_update_page_properties
tools.description: Update properties of a page or an item in a Notion database

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

start_cursor.description: Pagination start cursor for listing users

tools.name: notion_list_all_users
tools.description: List all users in the Notion workspace. **Note:** This function requires upgrading to the Notion Enterprise plan and using an Organization API key to avoid permission errors.

user_id.description: The ID of the user to retrieve.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

tools.name: notion_retrieve_user
tools.description: Retrieve a specific user by user_id in Notion. **Note:** This function requires upgrading to the Notion Enterprise plan and using an Organization API key to avoid permission errors.

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

tools.name: notion_retrieve_bot_user
tools.description: Retrieve the bot user associated with the current token in Notion

mention.description: Mention object if type is 'mention'. Represents an inline mention of a database, date, link preview, page, template mention, or user.

date.description: Date mention object, containing a date property value object.

start.description: An ISO 8601 formatted start date or date-time.

end.description: An ISO 8601 formatted end date or date-time, or null if not a range.

time_zone.description: Time zone information for start and end. If null, times are in UTC.

database.description: Database mention object. Contains a database reference with an 'id' field.

id.description: The ID of the mentioned database.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

link_preview.description: Link Preview mention object, containing a URL for the link preview.

url.description: The URL for the link preview.

template_mention.description: Template mention object, can be a template_mention_date or template_mention_user.

template_mention_user.description: For template_mention_user type, the user keyword.

template_mention_date.description: For template_mention_date type, the date keyword.

page.description: Page mention object, containing a page reference with an 'id' field.

id.description: The ID of the mentioned page.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

user.description: User mention object, contains a user reference.

id.description: The ID of the user.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

properties.description: The properties of a database to be changed in the request, in the form of a JSON object.

database_id.description: The ID of the database to add the item to.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

properties.description: Properties of the new database item. These should match the database schema.

tools.name: notion_create_database_item
tools.description: Create a new item (page) in a Notion database

parent.description: Parent object that specifies the page to comment on. Must include a page_id if used.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to comment on.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

rich_text.description: Array of rich text objects representing the comment content.

equation.description: Equation object if type is 'equation'. Represents an inline LaTeX equation.

expression.description: LaTeX string representing the inline equation.

annotations.description: Styling information for the text. By default, give nothing for default text.

text.description: Object containing text content and optional link info. Required if type is 'text'.

link.description: Optional link object with a 'url' field. Do NOT provide a NULL value, just ignore this field no link.

url.description: The URL the text links to.

href.description: The URL of any link or mention in this text, if any. Do NOT provide a NULL value, just ignore this field if there is no link or mention.

type.description: The type of this rich text object. Possible values: text, mention, equation.

mention.description: Mention object if type is 'mention'. Represents an inline mention of a database, date, link preview, page, template mention, or user.

date.description: Date mention object, containing a date property value object.

start.description: An ISO 8601 formatted start date or date-time.

end.description: An ISO 8601 formatted end date or date-time, or null if not a range.

time_zone.description: Time zone information for start and end. If null, times are in UTC.

database.description: Database mention object. Contains a database reference with an 'id' field.

id.description: The ID of the mentioned database.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

link_preview.description: Link Preview mention object, containing a URL for the link preview.

url.description: The URL for the link preview.

template_mention.description: Template mention object, can be a template_mention_date or template_mention_user.

template_mention_user.description: For template_mention_user type, the user keyword.

template_mention_date.description: For template_mention_date type, the date keyword.

page.description: Page mention object, containing a page reference with an 'id' field.

id.description: The ID of the mentioned page.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

user.description: User mention object, contains a user reference.

id.description: The ID of the user.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

discussion_id.description: The ID of an existing discussion thread to add a comment to.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

tools.name: notion_create_comment
tools.description: Create a comment in Notion. This requires the integration to have 'insert comment' capabilities. You can either specify a page parent or a discussion_id, but not both.

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

start_cursor.description: If supplied, returns a page of results starting after the cursor.

block_id.description: The ID of the block or page whose comments you want to retrieve.It should be a 32-character string (excluding hyphens) formatted as 8-4-4-4-12 with hyphens (-).

tools.name: notion_retrieve_comments
tools.description: Retrieve a list of unresolved comments from a Notion page or block. Requires the integration to have 'read comment' capabilities.

filter.description: Filter results by object type (page or database)

query.description: Text to search for in page or database titles

format.description: Specify the response format. 'json' returns the original data structure, 'markdown' returns a more readable format. Use 'markdown' when the user only needs to read the page and isn't planning to write or modify it. Use 'json' when the user needs to read the page with the intention of writing to or modifying it.

tools.name: notion_search
tools.description: Search pages or databases by title in Notion
